summary: This is an email chain from December 18, 2020, regarding the reproduction of discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case due to incorrect Bates numbering. It involves coordination between a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY and other parties to send corrected documents to defense counsel and to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the defendant in the case and is incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), to whom corrected discovery materials are being sent.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: A paralegal at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY who discovered Bates numbering errors in discovery materials, is correcting them, and coordinating their delivery to defense counsel and Maxwell at MDC.

connections.description: The paralegal specialist is involved in the prosecution's discovery process, preparing and sending corrected legal documents to Maxwell, the defendant.

events.title: Discovery Reproduction for Maxwell Case
events.description: A paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY identifies and corrects Bates numbering errors in seven discovery items for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, preparing to send them to defense counsel and to Maxwell at MDC.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On December 18, 2020, a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY discovered Bates numbering errors in seven discovery items related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The errors involved missing digits in the middle of Bates numbers, requiring the reproduction of one Excel file and six PDFs.
Corrected materials were to be sent to defense counsel and to Ghislaine Maxwell, who was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The correspondence indicates ongoing discovery and legal procedural activities in the Maxwell prosecution as of late 2020.
